column7: Not implemented.

Return the clip first frame time code and the clip duration.
The Tc returned include the Drop/NoDrop bit on NTSC configuration (so does the function A8 17 and B8 06)
Same as A8 16 but after the clip duration, it also returns the clip machine number (used mainly with “ID Louth” configuration) on one byte.

Return the clip status bit.
Bit 0 : 1 if the clip exist.
Bit 1 : 1 if the clip is preloaded.
Bit 4: ToStore (EVS) if the clip has to be saved on the Xfile.
Bit 5: IsStored, if the clip is saved on
the XFile.
If the clip ID is loaded in a channel, the clip deletion will failed.
Asks for an EVS event from the queue.
Sets the target machine used with the RecordCueUpWhithData (only whith IDLouth)

column6:
when x = 0 single clip request
when x = 1, # clips can be specified in the send data

Bit 0 loop mode enable,
0=false 1=true
Bit 1 is single clip/timeline
0=single clip
1=timeline

0 = Off
1 = Freeze on last frame
2 = Freeze on next clip
3 = Show black

2 Bytes for the length N of the clip name N Bytes for each character of the clip name
4 Byte in point timecode (format is FFSSMMHH)
4 Byte out point timecode (format is FFSSMMHH)
One-byte signed integer, which is the number of clips to skip (negative for backwards).
